intro: Astrocodon piperi, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. Astrocodon piperi is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
